thread.title: All hell breaks loose! Akhilesh-Rahul’s wagon fails to reach destination, then their stage collapses
thread.title_full: All hell breaks loose! Akhilesh-Rahul’s wagon fails to reach destination, then their stage collapses

author: FE Online
title: All hell breaks loose! Akhilesh-Rahul’s wagon fails to reach destination, then their stage collapses
text:
All hell breaks loose! Akhilesh-Rahul’s wagon fails to reach destination, then their stage collapses All hell breaks loose! Akhilesh-Rahul’s wagon fails to reach destination, then their stage collapses While everything went as planned for the two leaders till evening, their road-show was came to a halt at 5 pm as District Magistrate ordered to wrap the show citing election code of conduct. By: FE Online | New Delhi | Published: February 21, 2017 8:09 PM stage prepared for public gathering of the two leaders in city’s Gol Park collapsed just before the two leaders were about to reach the venue. (PTI) 
All hell broke loose on Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Akhilesh Yadav and Congress vice president Rahul Gandhi as the duo embarked on their ‘Vijay Rath Yatra’ election campaign road-show on Tuesday. While everything went as planned for the two leaders till evening, their road-show was came to a halt at 5 pm as District Magistrate ordered to wrap the show citing election code of conduct. Rahul, who had stayed in Sangam Nagri overnight, was joined by the Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister for their road show, which commenced at the Balson Chauraha (crossing) facing the historic Anand Bhawan. 
Meanwhile, the stage prepared for public gathering of the two leaders in city’s Gol Park collapsed just before the two leaders were about to reach the venue. No casualties were reported, however, the gathering and leaders’ address couldn’t take place. Meanwhile, BJP President Amit Shah also conducted a road show in the city. #WATCH : Gol Park stage collapses, Akhilesh Yadav & Rahul Gandhi were to address from here after joint roadshow in Allahabad #UPPolls2017 pic.twitter.com/doIHdUAxE2 
— ANI UP (@ANINewsUP) February 21, 2017 
The campaign for the fourth phase of the Uttar Pradesh polls has been concluded. Polling will take place on February 23. Districts in Bundelkhand region, which include Jalaun, Jhansi, Lalitpur, Mahoba, Banda, Hamirpur, Chitrakoot and Fatehpur — are among those that will see polling on Thursday. Two candidates in the city fielded by the Congress-SP combine – two-time MLA Anugrah Narayan Singh from Allahabad (North) and debutant Richa Singh from Allahabad (West)- have formerly been presidents of the AU students union. Besides, the Chief Minister’s cousin and Badaun MP Dharmendra Yadav, who stood beside the two leaders during the road show, has been an AU alumnus. 
Prominent parliamentary contituencies, including Pratapgarh, Allahabad and Rae Bareli, the parliamentary constituency represented by Congress President Sonia Gandhi will go to vote. 680 candidates are in the fray for 57 Assembly seats, including the maximum number of 26 from the Allahabad North constituency.
